name: indeterminacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of not being measured, counted, or clearly known: A sort of moral indeterminacy has always been at the centre of his art. He is bothered by the indeterminacy that quantum theory ascribes to the physical world. See
indeterminate
More examplesFewer examplesAs a novelist and playwright, he is attuned to the indeterminacy of the inner world.In complex issues, uncertainty, ignorance, and indeterminacy are always present. The meanings of modal words involve an element of indeterminacy that somewhat resembles ambiguity.
